article_title: If Schoolhouse Rock remade ‘I’m Just a Bill’ today, it would be depressing

article_metadata.description: In 1976, Schoolhouse Rock made an adorable, iconic character out of a pathetic scrap of paper with one signature tune. “I’m Just a Bill,” which explained how a bill becomes law in Congress, has become a touchstone of civic education for generations of American schoolchildren.

og.description: The iconic 1976 animation describing how a bill becomes a law bears only scant resemblance to the process as it functions — or dysfunctions — today.
og.title: If Schoolhouse Rock remade ‘I’m Just a Bill’ today, it would be depressing
